intro: Chisocheton multijugis var. glabrior, commonly known as the smooth-leafed chisocheton, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
